newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens, Adtranz win Halle contract.
newsitem.headline: Siemens, Adtranz win Halle contract.

text.p: Hallesche Verkehrs AG (HAVAG) awarded a 140 million mark transportation contract to Siemens AG, Adtranz and Deutsche Waggonbau AG (DWA), the companies said in a joint statement.

Havag, the transportation board of the city of Halle, ordered 38 street cars, the first of which are to be delivered in August 1997. The purchase is an extension of an existing contract that provided for the purchase of up to 120 vehicles.

Adtranz, a joint venture of Swiss-Swedish Asea Brown Boveri and Daimler Benz AG, will supply the electrical components and technical coordination, while Siemens supplies the motors and Siemens Duewag and DWA the mechanical parts.
